comments.body: Baboons zebras lizards and pythons would go great with this idea pythons would be hostile mobs and would hunt baboons. Zebras would kick if attacked cheetahs and lions would hunt it.Baboons would hunt lizards and spiders leaves and grass. Lizards would eat grass and could be tamed with berries and spider eyes it would attack spiders it could also jump on our shoulder if tamed
Thanks for the idea:)
Hippos would be great would live near rivers and eat grass and would fight each other and kill crocs on sight
a croc can kill a hippo there will have to be more than one hippo DireDinoguy
I think that there could also be added Pillager poachers, that time for the Cheetahs hide, and by stopping it you can become and I quote the king of the jungle LOL
Add elephants, giraffes, and other animals of the African savannah
Good idea - you just need to explain what they will do.
Giant salamanders could be a rare variant of axolotls.

These mobs could live on the bottom of river beds and occasionally come up. Their diet could be made of insects (spiders, silverfish, etc) and potentially a new crayfish mob. It would also be nice to give these lazy amphibians some sort of farming ability, as then the community wouldn’t deem them useless.

I think it would make a lot of sense for the two other mushrooms to get their own mooshrooms.  A warped mooshroom would turn crimson when struck by lightning, and piglins would be afraid of the warped mooshroom.  I like your backstory, although I think that they should remain Nethery even when brought into the Overworld.

Horses should be able to ford water up to several layers deep.  I don’t expect them to swim across oceans, but crossing rivers shouldn’t require a one block depth of water or bridges.  

 

If normal horses cannot do it, can we enchant horse armor so it can float in water?
Agreed!  This is the most annoying thing about horses!  It doesn't need to be an ocean - but at least several layers be able to cross.
yes this should be added in real life horses can swim while being rode one
Suggestion: maybe you could tame polar bears and make them attack phantoms like with wolves and skeletons?
385570477572 I like your idea, but you can't really tame polar bears in real life, so I think the trust system (like with foxes) would be better for the polar bear.
The trust system is a good idea, but how do you get them to trust you?
386286492912 perhaps you could make them trust you by feeding them raw fish, because with other mobs, you get them to trust you by feeding them.
same trust mechanic as foxes, however, it would be harder because the adult polar bears will attack you.
I hope they add this because it is a great idea!
Great Idea!
it would be very cool

Never thought of a flower like that. But we do have wither roses. Also, this should be part of the cave update. Currently, mining in caves is relatively boring. The only dangers you'll encounter are lava, gravel, and mobs. Plus, wither roses only grow if there's a wither.

Love the idea. I do agree with Player581052885 though, it should be in the cave update. I definitely would like to see a stationary mob in the game since we have none of those and this would provide a new challenge for players in the caves.
That's a great idea! I agree with everyone else, these should totally be found in lush caves. Maybe they could drop flowers too, so you could make dye and stuff.
I think it would be a  bad idea for it to be tameable sorry but that's why I thought of the fire spirt pet.
It should be called the hellhound, not a devil dog.

It could be tamed using rotten flesh, or maybe wither skeletons could start dropping wither bones when you kill them and you could take the dog with that. Maybe It would only be hostile when it is wild and has pups (like polar bears) or when a player stays around it for too long (like angry pandas). It might also attack other mobs like wolves do.
I agree, they are super glitchy rn.

They should not spawn in well lit areas and they should not spawn on blocks that other mobs dont spawn on, like halfslabs. There needs to be a way for the player to make an area safe if he wants to. This and also having the annoying trader spawn every five minutes to sell garbade gets old really fast.

Having an extra challenge for players who want more pve is great but also casual players should be able to disable spawning in an area or repel for example flying hostile mobs in the overworld. I like having the pve element there but being able to light up an area and be able to do my own thing and build for a while without being bothered is equally important. Maybe make it possible to disable pillagers and the trader from the menu could be a temporary solution. There could also be a structure to summon the trader, rather than him spawning at random constantly.

I wonder if Mojang is just going to add random crap to drop on Your head at random while you are trying to work. I will og to their workplace and throw cranky old cats at them every five minutes or so, see how easy they think it is to work like that:D.

WaterChalice makes a good point - you should be able to build a base which you have 100% confidence enemies will not spawn in if you put in the effort (without having to resort to mods, as people on the bedrock edition don't have access to them). Illagers should not ignore light level (which every other hostile mob in the overworld respects) or half slabs - those two restrictions are only going to be present reliably in a base. As a potential compromise, to allow them to still spawn to attack villages during the day, they could potentially ignore *sunlight* when determining light level but still pay attention to light level.

Forcing players who don't want to deal with enemies to do so at random times is only going to piss people off, not boost "engagement" metrics.
I’m so ready for this to be over

After a long break I dove back in to MCPE yesterday. I am VERY disappointed that the elaborate worlds I created now have to be set to easy or all my villagers get wiped out because of stupid patrols spawning EVERYWHERE.This does not make me want to play more.

I enjoy the random patrol when I am out in the "wild".... but not at "home".

It's pretty simple to fix. Have patrols follow hostile spawn rules since they are hostile mobs. If I light up a village light a Christmas tree and wall it off, if should be "safe". NOT subject to patrols spawning all over the pace and killing all my villagers.

This is nightmare, i have a very small room underground with villagers farmers. Pillagers spawn inside of it on glazed terra-cotta and killed them all, where's realistic ?? They should only spawn on natural blocks, because that has no sense.

Use logic: How they are getting inside of any building by just walking like patrols do...
This is done in Java (1.14.3) so I don't see any reason why it is not in Bedrock.

Just started new world and patrols keeps spawning inside my house. They shouldn't be able to spawn inside buildings that are well lit up. I really don't want carpet everywhere or use bottom half of slabs. Hope it gets changed
This would take away the purpose of the Guardians seeing that they drop those items.
True but these mobs will be very uncommon and only in special structures
So mention those special structures.
Idk, shipwrecks maybe?
Drowned spawn there. We don't need it to be any harder to get the loot from the ships.
If you don't know what structures they should spawn in, then why even mention it at all?

maybe they could spawn in the ocean around the the oceal monuments, but bit further way so you dont have to worry about fighting both them and gaurdians at the same time

or maybe just a really rare spawning mob in deep oceans, and spawn in small groups of 2-4
Good idea!
Also try to be more tactful BlastBurner

I do really like this idea and would love to see it implemented. I had the same thought of a “wander” mode for my dog. But not have it apply to just dogs. Have it also apply to tamed cats. It would be better than having them just sit in my house or in just one spot. I do like the difference crafting for the collars however it would be a lot of work since it would need to spawn a tamed wolf with a “follow” collar and would also include the need for a crafting recipe to be made to dye each collar variant to each color variant as well as create textures for all of the items that would be created. A different way to implement this mechanic could be an item like a name tag. Have a UI for the dog/cat and have a slot for a name tag. Have a bar in the UI, next to the tag slot, that displays the current mode the pet is in. When clicked, it would change modes. There could also be a bar like this for setting the “wander” radius. I like the wander radius being set to where the collar is crafted/put on(or in the case of the tag UI, mode activated), but if the need for a different anchor method was to come up, maybe a food bowl as an anchor point. The bowl item could also have food put it in for the pet(s) that are set to wander/guard if they happen to take damage. I really do like the concept of having more for our pets to do. And for house with indoor and outdoor spaces, instead of making it so tamed pets could open full size doors, why not make it so tamed pets could open trapdoors?

My gosh, YES! I have a HUGE dog house on my island and it takes up so much SPACE! I love My Dog!

 

 

 

#NinjaRaptor

I like the idea of letting tamed wolves and cats wander around a certain radius or fenced area and defending without necessarily following. Then the cats could still sleep on beds and purr when no enemies are present instead of sitting and meowing all the time. Dogs could roam and play with each other or with villager children when not following or sitting.
Some method of having pets roam locally would be nice, other than a tied rope. It would be nice if cats could climb on things and sleep in beds without risk of following you to death on adventures.

I certainly like this idea, but I was thinking you would shift-click the dog or cat and it would wander around your base but not necessarily follow you. It might stay within the walls of your base but not more than like 20 to 30 blocks away from the point you set it to wander mode. Also it might run up to you when you come back to your base and make it feel more lively. Lastly I'm think that when in wander mode you would see more interaction like dogs in wander mode would chase cats in wander mode and dogs might still follow you if your in their range and certainly when you hold food they will eat, or even lay down by your bed when it's night.
This needs to happen
Yes! I don't know why this didn't make it into the Bedrock Edition.  All the other colors should work too - Red + Yellow for Orange, White + Red for Pink, etc.
And yellow dye + blue dye = green dye
honestly it makes no sense that this thing only works with very few colors, i don’t know why this is not a thing, not even just with the sheep also just with color recipies.
Honestly to say that this needs color matching

What I want done: Blue + Yellow sheep = green shep
Why I want it done: I can't find a desert in my multiplayer server with friends. I have plenty of blue & yellow dye, and I have two players asking for a lime green bed (in adition to maybe wanting one myself) and I just think this is dumb. I spawn next to a taiga and a snowy mountains biome and I haven't found a single warm biome. I've gotten lost like 10 times just for a single cactus and at this point. Also, the minecraft wiki says "Sea pickle colonies generate on the bottom of WARM oceans and are found on top of coral blocks in coral reefs." on the page for sea pickels, so to get a popular dye you need a warm biome... where it logically could just be obtained by breeding sheep.
How you could do it: Just like other sheep breeding in Java, you could add this to the list of combos. Also maybe add this feature to bedrock.
They would great

An ender cat could only be found in ender cities, possibly being the pets of the endermen? They would be able to teleport or even move by levitating from one place to another. The benefit of having one is possible to stop endermen from attacking you when you're within a certain block range of the cat, the cat can give you temporary night vision within range, the cat can grow into a big cat (like a panther) for you to mount and ride, or maybe it can be the only cat that will attack for you. They could be tamed via raw fish covered in chorus fruit juice. Or maybe, the endermen could be afraid of these cats as they eat some type of fish coated with the juices of ender eyes. But that may be morbid? I don't know.

I think a hell hound would be much cooler than a cat for the nether. They could give you fire resistance when in range, maybe lead you towards the nearest nether fortress, morph into a larger hell hound for you to mount and ride, will deal fire damage when it attacks mobs (straight-up burning hostiles and immediately cooking passives), can swim through lava with no problems, or will be the only pet mob that can serve as a traveling light source (as in it can light up the area surrounding it almost like a torch but not really), They could be tamed with bones sprinkled with blaze powder. Yum.
I love the kittys too and I like the idea of them getting bigger to where you can ride them.
You took the idea from a book! A book! Have you ever heard about ebbs?!!
MOJANG AD THIS IN THE ENDER UPDATE, PLEASE
great idea
EEEEEEE! LIKE EBBS BUT THE ENDER GENERATION! EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE!
It’s too obscure.
And what if they attack cod and lure them in with there lure

Personally I disagree with Anglerfish being hostile to players, they're quite small fish and they only hunt other fish, there are no attacks from the fish on record either.
That being said though I would love to see this mob added into the game, however, I'd like it as a passive entity, hunting small fish every now and again, perhaps it could function as a moving light source in the deep seas, helping players see where they otherwise could not?
Really cool, idea its currently international ocean week great way to celebrate it.
This needs to be a thing ASAP!
I want this
This is so annoying I traveled 3500 blocks and I got my two allays I just walked and my allays lost me WE NEED THIS
This definitely still needs to be added.

also I understand if your worried about programming in something like extra art for variants of frogs since you never did so for axolotles or clownfish but still, please put frog in bucket, also you know what, you should make it so that you can catch fireflies in a jar and feed them to frogs just like cookies and parrots, to be fair I dont want to kill my frog but still you should do that in my opinion since they were originally gonna be frog food so you might as well at least make it possible to feed them to frogs, albeit lethal to the frog and the firefly. Also, I think you should do that because then you can use the firefly jars as light sources, maybe even the first or only light sources you can hold in your hand and still use, and you could have the fireflies as pets, anyways I also think this should be the case because fireflies have had a long history in MC mods so they should be added in my opinion
Yeah, especially since Frogs and Axolotls are both amphibians. It also just seems like it would be such a quality of life improvement!

I stan this idea, but would take it a step further and allow frogs to be picked with a bare hand. This accomplishes everything that the bucket would, and picking up frogs is just something people do! : )
This needs to be added to the game.
it makes sense.
yea

uma ideia boa ter mais um pet para fazer pet shop e deveria ter um craft para fazer a casinha do hamster
aaawww the hamster is so cute pls mojang add the hamsters in the 1.21 pllllllllls
The Hamster could drop seeds a few Times a day, so that it's possible to get like Melon seeds, Pumpkins seeds, or just usual seeds. He's sleeping at daytime like the fox.
I think it would be cool if you could tame and ride the crocodiles. It could be like with horses where you tame and then saddle them so you can control them the same way.
yeeeeeah spiky armor

YES!! CROCODILE MOBS!!!

I completely disagree that they should deal 2 hearts damage and have a slow bite. I think it should be fast and deal more damage to be more realistic. I also think they should be hostile. The dropped tooth idea is cool, and the spiked armor idea as well. I think the tooth should be used in a potion.

Please, Minecraft, add crocodiles.
Ugh... I absolutely hate it when they spawn in weird spots and it takes forever to find them all!

My base is cursed by lost raiders forever blowing their blasted horn! This is more in bug territory than gameplay. Pillagers live on the surface so why would they appear randomly underground.

A simple fix would be to have a raid timer. If the first waves of pillagers don't meet any resistance, then they should despawn and after the time has expired, the raid should end.

The pillagers are looking for the player to seek revenge, so if the player isn't seen by the pillagers' the scouts should leave the area.

Fix this bug!
This would break raid farms completely

I am about to build a raid platform as I don't want a raid farm as too op, but I can't keep chasing them underground.  Often the raid times out before I can find them.  I would be happy if the 'bell' in Java mechanic worked then at least we know a little more.  The horn sound changing does help, but it can take me 10 - 30 mins to find one wave or time out. Thank you
I love this idea, especially the tameable part. I can imagine a personal flock of eagles!
be able to hunt ????????

Well all I can say is w o w
---------
They might be like the wolf of the sky

I don't want them to be tameable necessarily. I've wanted something to hunt in the sky with a bow and arrow for many years now and this has always been what I imagined. In stead of phantoms being the only reason to look up for, there'd be eagles. I would therefor like them to drop something useful. They can be tameable, but that would somehow make it sad to hunt them. xD

The most important thing is that there's something in those endless, empty skies at last. They're not being used at all.
I love this idea!
Do it
